intro: Staurogyne latibracteata, commonly known as the broad-bract staurogyne, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and distinctive, broad bracts that enclose the inflorescence. Its leaves are typically opposite and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Staurogyne latibracteata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and swampy areas.
